documentation.text:
LiteSig Factory creates new instances of the multisig contract and triggers an event
 for listeners to see the new contract.

Function called by external addresses to create a new multisig contract
 Caller must be whitelisted as an admin - this is to prevent someone from sniping the address
 (the standard approach to locking in the sender addr into the salt was not chosen in case a long time
 passes before the contract is created and a new deployment account is required for some unknown reason)

LiteSig Factory creates new instances of the multisig contract and triggers an event
 for listeners to see the new contract.

Function called by external addresses to create a new multisig contract
 Caller must be whitelisted as an admin - this is to prevent someone from sniping the address
 (the standard approach to locking in the sender addr into the salt was not chosen in case a long time
 passes before the contract is created and a new deployment account is required for some unknown reason)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addAdmin(address).notice: Add an admin to the list.  This should only be callable by the owner of the contract.

createLiteSig(bytes32,address[],uint256,.notice: Function called by external addresses to create a new multisig contract Caller must be whitelisted as an admin - this is to prevent someone from sniping the address (the standard approach to locking in the sender addr into the salt was not chosen in case a long time passes before the contract is created and a new deployment account is required for some unknown reason)

isAdministrator(address).notice: Determine if the message sender is in the administrators list.

removeAdmin(address).notice: Remove an admin from the list.  This should only be callable by the owner of the contract.

userdoc.notice: LiteSig Factory creates new instances of the multisig contract and triggers an event for listeners to see the new contract.
